title: [jit][script] differentiating tensor.chunk gives error
body_html:
Repro:


import torch
@torch.jit.script
def halve(input):
    x, y = input.chunk(2, 1)
    return x, y

input = torch.tensor(torch.arange(0, 10).view(5, -1), requires_grad=True)
halve(input)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
RuntimeError                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-19-6a7415060fdf> in <module>()
      6
      7 input = torch.tensor(torch.arange(0, 10).view(5, -1), requires_grad=True)
----> 8 halve(input)

RuntimeError: torch/csrc/jit/autodiff.cpp:194: createZerosLike: can't allocate zero gradient for a va
lue without a type

From some time in gdb, my guess is that it's trying to allocate a zero gradient for the integer inputs to chunk but I'm not sure.

cc @zdevito
